After careful consideration, the decision has been made to not allow students to transfer between traditional, virtual, and blended classes after Wednesday, September 2nd for the remainder of the fall semester. If you would like to make a change to your child’s current class, please notify the school before the end of the day on September 2nd.

When we originally started planning for this school year, our intentions were to allow students to transition between traditional, virtual and blended as desired. Since the beginning of the school year, many of our students have swapped multiple times. Simply, this is problematic for our teachers, counselors and administrators because it reduces our focus on teaching and learning.

Please remember to contact your child’s school before Wednesday, September 2nd by the close of the school day if there is a change with his or her current choice. We appreciate your continued support.

⚠️The Coronavirus is predicted to peak in Alabama during the next two weeks, and Governor Ivey has issued a Stay at Home order that lasts through the end of April. With much consideration, the Lawrence County School System has decided to suspend meal services until the health situation improves. It is impossible for our employees to maintain the proper distance when they are preparing and distributing meals. We want to ensure our employees stay healthy, and we are not spreading this virus.

➡️Our plans are to resume meal service after the health situation improves. We are thankful for the opportunity to serve our communities during the last month, and we hope to be able to resume meal service soon.

➡️The first instructional packets should be mailed and received during the next week, the week of Monday, April 13th. We are still deciding on the best option to return packets. Please keep this packet once it has been completed until we decide the best way to return it.

➡️Your teacher’s weekly calls will continue. If you need assistance with the packet, please let your teacher know.

A separate schoolcast call with specific instructions for each school will be sent Tuesday afternoon.

From March 19th to April 5th, all school campuses are closed. This means civic groups, athletic teams, school staff members, and all other members of the public should not visit school campuses during these dates. Again, this mandatory closure is for the health and welfare of our students, employees and communities.
